::Prowl/Firearm::

Firearm sighs, looking down at Iron Raptor and Prowl.

"Let's go," he says quietly to the bots around him, not hearing Inu's offer, 
"They'll need privacy."

Motioning to Cybershark, Inu, and whoever else was in the room, Firearm walks 
out, heading for the bridge and forgetting about his own wounds.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Prowl's dimmed optics lighten slightly as Iron Raptor's voice reaches his 
ears. He couldn't make out the words, but she sounded sad, almost pleeding 
for something. An image of her crying face came into focus as Prowl regained 
consciousness, and he could feel her fingers on his face. A surge of pain 
goes out from his shoulder as Iron Raptor shakes him, mech fluid continuing 
to leak onto the ground.

Prowl could feel her tears dripping onto his armor. He was relieved that she 
was at least touching him. He had thought that he would never feel her touch 
again, but he was glad that he had been wrong. Prowl tries to open his mouth 
to say something, but only half of his systems were functioning, and his 
audio generators were not among them.

Slowly, Prowl raises his arm, stroking his fingers against Iron Raptor's 
cheek. His hand strokes down to her neck before going limp, not enough energy 
to keep it up. He felt the room start to fade, more of his systems begining 
to shut down. But there was something he still had to do before he could go. 
Diverting most of his energy to his audio generators, Prowl feels them 
reactivate, his lips begining to move, but barely.

"I love you," he whispers in a barely audible voice. He could feel more of 
his systems shutting down, the room continuing to, fade. Feeling more and 
more lightheaded, Prowl knew that death was coming. Soon, he would be one 
with the Matrix .... once more.

But no! He couldn't die yet! For many reasons, but one in particular: Iron 
Raptor. If he died, she would have no one to love. He knew she would be sad, 
and the main reason of his life was to make her happy. Prowl slowly leans his 
head back, fighting to focus his optics on her face. All he wanted was to 
kiss her one more time, just once, to feel her lips on his before he died. 
Prowl looks up at Iron Raptor, his optics filled with love, but fading 
rapidly.
